StandardReader Class Reference

The standard implementation for a Reader, many of the modules have their own sub-classes. More...

#include <StandardReader.h>

Handle a packet
Methods to handle one incomming packet.

Methods to handle one incomming packet. What method to call depends on if the module is running as leader or available and if the incomming packet is a control-packet or not. A control-packet is a packet that have the control bit set in the subtype.

See also:
Packet


  • void processPacket (Packet *p)
    Function that processes the incomming packet.
  • void sendVoteToAll ()
    Sends vote packet to availables and leaders.
  • void replyToVote (const VotePacket *p)
    Sends back vote packet to sender only.
  • void processVotePacket (VotePacket *p, bool wasLeader)
    Processes a VotePacket.
  • virtual void printDebugPacketInfo (Packet *p)
    Method, that is called by processPacket.
  • virtual bool availableProcessCtrlPacket (Packet *p)
    Process one control packet, when running as available.
  • virtual bool availableProcessNonCtrlPacket (Packet *p)
    Process one non-control packet, when running as available.
  • virtual bool leaderProcessCtrlPacket (Packet *p)
    Process one control packet, when running as leader.
  • virtual bool leaderProcessNonCtrlPacket (Packet *p)
    Process one non-control packet, when running as leader.

Detailed Description

The standard implementation for a Reader, many of the modules have their own sub-classes.

Definition at line 56 of file StandardReader.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum [protected]
 

Status in voting procedure.

Possible values: {description} [NO_VOTING] Currently no election (default). [LOST] Beaten in the election will not become leader. [WON_1] Sent "VOTE" once. [WON_2] Sent "VOTE" twice. [WON_3] Sent "VOTE" three times. {description}

Enumeration values:
NO_VOTING 
LOST 
WON_1 
WON_2 
WON_3

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

StandardReader::StandardReader (  moduletype_t  moduleType,
Queue *  inQueue,
NetPacketQueue &  sendQueue,
MapSafeVector *  p_loadedMaps,
PacketReaderThread &  packetReader,
uint16  listenPort,
int32  definedRank,
bool  usesMaps = true,
vector< PushService * > *  wantedSubscriptions = NULL,
bool  waitForPush = false
) 
 

The only constructor for the reader.

Initialize the module { not} to be a leader.

Parameters:
moduleType The type of module.
q The queue that the jobs are inserted in.
preferedPort Portnumber to be used for communication with only this module. If the portnumber is already in use it will b increased until a free one is found.
leaderIP The IP-address to the leader-multicast group in hex.
leaderPort The port used for leader-group.
availableIP The IP-address to the available-multicast group in hex.
availablePort The port used for available-gruop.
definedRank How ``good'' this module is when selecting new leader. {This might change when the ``ini-fil-object'' is in use.}
usesMaps True if the module uses maps, otherwise false.
wantedSubscriptions Vector containing PushServices wanted by the module. Should not be deleted by the caller.

AliveReplyPacket* StandardReader::processAliveRequestPacket (  const AliveRequestPacket *  arp  )  const [inline, protected]
 

Processes an AliveRequestPacket and returns an AliveReplyPacket.

Parameters:
arp The packet to process.
Returns:
A reply to that packet.

void StandardReader::processPacket (  Packet *  p  )  [protected]
 

Function that processes the incomming packet.

Will call one of the following methods: {description} [availableProcessCtrlPacket(Packet* p)] This method is called if this module is running as available and p is a control packet. [availableProcessNonCtrlPacket(Packet* p)] This method is called if this module is running as available and p not is a control packet. [leaderProcessCtrlPacket(Packet* p)] This method is called if this module is running as leader and p is a control packet. [leaderProcessNonCtrlPacket(Packet* p)] This method is called if this module is running as leader and p not is a control packet. {description}

Parameters:
p The packet to be processed.

void StandardReader::processVotePacket (  VotePacket *  p,
bool  wasLeader
)  [protected]
 

Processes a VotePacket.

If the VotePacket comes from a module that is a better leader no packet will be sent. If this module is a better leader a VotePacket will be sent and this module will become leader and continue to send VotePackets until the other modules are silent.

Parameters:
p The received VotePacket.
wasLeader True if the module was leader when the VotePacket was received.

void StandardReader::reactToMapLoaded (  LoadMapReplyPacket *  replyPacket  )  [protected]
 

This method is called when a LoadMapReplyPacket is received by the processor.

If the map was loaded OK the moduleList is updated so that the module that loaded the map can start receiving requests right away, without having to wait for the StatisticsPacket. If the map was not loaded OK or the module was not in the module list then a HeartBeatPacket will be sent out to all modules. <br /> Used to be a virtual method which the RouteModule used to create DisturbanceSubscriptions, but not anymore.

Parameters:
replyPacket The LoadMapReplyPacket from the module that has finished loading the map.

virtual bool StandardReader::readPropValues (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Read from the property file to get the initial values.

Virtual to make it possible for modules to read other values. Subclasses readPropValues() can call this method after setting their special values as only MAX_UINTXX values will be affected.

Returns:
True if all values were found. False if one or more values couldn't be found and defaults were used.

virtual void StandardReader::replyToHeartBeat (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Defines what to do when a heartbeat is received.
